definition: to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to

sentences.english: Sometimes, there are over 1000 Africans attending mass.
sentences.chinese: 有时侯，会有超过1000名非洲人参加弥撒。

sentences.english: A congregation in Vorkuta gathers to celebrate Easter at a midnight Mass.
sentences.chinese: 沃尔库塔会众在午夜弥撒上团聚，庆祝复活节。

sentences.english: There are 60 parishes and 33 centres for Mass.
sentences.chinese: 全港共有60个堂区和有33个弥撒中心。

sentences.english: The celebrant vested himself in the sanctuary.
sentences.chinese: 主持弥撒的神甫在祭坛上穿上祭袍。

sentences.english: The Mass to close the event was presided over by Bishop Ri.
sentences.chinese: 大会由李主教主持的弥撒结束。

sentences.english: He composed church music, including "Mass in BI minor".
sentences.chinese: 他创作了教堂乐曲，其中包括《BI小调弥撒曲》。

sentences.english: Yihong used to tell me that they were always late for Mass.
sentences.chinese: 一红曾跟我说他们去做弥撒的时候总是迟到。

sentences.english: Venezuelans go to church in roller skates early on Christmas Day.
sentences.chinese: 委内瑞拉人在圣诞那天早上穿着滑冰鞋去教堂做弥撒。

sentences.english: He attended the Pope's msaa and received communion from his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他参与教宗举行的弥撒及由教宗亲手送圣体。

sentences.english: But, as I've read love's missal through to-day.
sentences.chinese: 但今天我已把爱的弥撒书读遍。

sentences.english: He went to Mass every morningbefore hitting the trading pit.
sentences.chinese: 每天早上到交易所上班前，他都会先去做弥撒。

sentences.english: After the mass of the resurrect ion they would all go to the graveside service.
sentences.chinese: 复活弥撒过后，他们还要去参加墓地葬礼。

sentences.english: The bride's bouquet may be replaced by an old family missal.
sentences.chinese: 而新娘的花束则用传统家庭的弥撒书取代。

sentences.english: He went regularly to low mass every Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 每逢礼拜日，他必按时去参加一次普通弥撒。

sentences.english: The priest celebrates Mass in church.
Near the end of the Mass Benedict walked down from the altar to distribute Holy Communion.
sentences.chinese: 在弥撒快结束时，教皇本笃走下神坛分发圣餐。

definition: to go to church on Sunday (of Christians)
Holy sacrament/Christian rite (esp. Protestant)/also called 聖事|圣事 by Catholics
